hey, so I used make to compile a kernel: how do I install it now?
do I have to do something with modprobe?
or like copy it someplace?
first copy it to /lib/modules/$(uname -r)/kernel/drivers/net/wireless/ then do depmod -a and then modprobe rt61
thanks. What should I do with the old rt61.ko module I want to replace?
yeah, rename it
depmod / modprobe only search for files with .ko extension
ok, I think I did it. is there any way to check the version of the driver that's currently running?
which driver?
the rt61 wireless driver. It should've replaced the default ones with the nightly build from CVS.
check the output of "dmesg"
then you still have the old driver running
i didnt know the old driver was still loaded
you have to set down the ra0 interface, rmmod rt61 and then modprobe rt61
should I reboot then? dmseg does include output related to the CVS version
no need for reboot
how should I switch it to the new driver then? ifup/down?
ifconfig ra0 down ; rmmod rt61 ; modprobe rt61
ok, now it works. For some reason it's wlan0 now instead of ra0, but I don't suppose that makes any difference
i think thats how the new driver is naming the interface
